body: Trying to move this one along. Did you get the needed help to run YCSB ?  For meeting, perhaps a Skype meeting with a link here would be good and let the reviewer drive it by asking you questions.

For privileges:

In order to create a library, you need MANAGE_LIBRARY privilege.  Today, we
set this privilege as:

CREATE COMPONENT PRIVILEGE MANAGE_LIBRARY AS 'ML' ON SQL_OPERATIONS SYSTEM

  DETAIL 'Allow grantee to manage libraries';

--  GRANT COMPONENT PRIVILEGE MANAGE_LIBRARY

ON SQL_OPERATIONS TO DB__ROOT

WITH GRANT OPTION;

GRANT COMPONENT PRIVILEGE MANAGE_LIBRARY

ON SQL_OPERATIONS TO DB__ROOTROLE

WITH GRANT OPTION;

In order to create a procedure, you need CREATE_PRIVILEGE privilege.  This
can be done by the schema owner, or by granting an entity the CREATE or
CREATE_PRIVILEGE privilege. Today we set this privilege as:

CREATE COMPONENT PRIVILEGE CREATE_PROCEDURE AS 'CP' ON SQL_OPERATIONS SYSTEM

  DETAIL 'Allow grantee to create procedures';

--  GRANT COMPONENT PRIVILEGE CREATE_PROCEDURE

ON SQL_OPERATIONS TO DB__ROOT

WITH GRANT OPTION;

GRANT COMPONENT PRIVILEGE CREATE_PROCEDURE

ON SQL_OPERATIONS TO DB__ROOTROLE

WITH GRANT OPTION;

In order to execute the procedure you need the EXECUTE object level
privilege.

I would leave privilege setting, as much as possible, to the  customer.
They are ultimately responsible for setting security.

So, I would just create the procedures as DB__ROOT and grant DB__ROOTROLE
the execute privilege with grant option.

The customer would then decide who (user or role) should be assigned this
privilege and perform appropriate grant statements.

   Roberta

_From:_ Hans Zeller [mailto:notifications@github.com]
_Sent:_ Tuesday, December 15, 2015 8:53 AM
_To:_ apache/incubator-trafodion incubator-trafodion@noreply.github.com
_Cc:_ Roberta Marton roberta.marton@esgyn.com
_Subject:_ Re: [incubator-trafodion] [TRAFODION-1668]initialize spj for
upload a customized jar (#203)

Looking at Roberta's comments and at the naming and location of these SPJs,
two more comments: We still have the question who should have execute
rights for these SPJs. We do not want PUBLIC to have this right, since we
are uploading code to the server. The other is naming: org.trafodion.mgmt
is probably too generic, this is about UDR library management. IMHO, it
would be good to put the code under
core/sql/src/main/java/org/trafodion/udr/library_management. Roberta, could
you propose the GRANT and possibly CREATE ROLE statements that we should
use?

â€”

.

jenkins, retest -- timeout failure due to hbase restart taking more time
Looks good to me.  Helps a bunch on test automation. Thanks.

Actually, here is one comment I want to make: We currently use the following ranges:

-p rand uses ports between 12000 and 24000
-p fromDisplay uses ports above 24000. If the display is less than 42, it stays below the boundary of the ephemeral range, which usually starts at 32K.

Since -p fromDisplay is meant to be deterministic, -p available should not use ports above 24000, since that would break the idea that once you have a display running, that guarantees a corresponding port range. Could we make -p available stay in the range between 12000 and 24000?
Do we have developer regression for spj mgmt code. Can we make sure we add them to regression test folder.

Hi Hans,

Thanks for the comment. I have submitted the rework. Thanks --Qifan

Note that this code is not exercised by the Jenkins test, so no need to wait for it (probably could do a skip test).

Changes look good Dave. Does this address TRAFODION-823 too? Should we open a separate, lower priority JIRA on the discovery you made that estimated rowcount can differ by about 10% depending on when it taken, before/after flush/compaction? It is an interesting problem, though I am not certain if the difference in estimate is sufficient for more attention

Hans is correct; this code will need further revision to support multiple column families. I didn't think of that when coding this solution. I was following the spirit of the algorithm that was there. Comparing keys would achieve multi-column family support. To Suresh's comment, hopefully HBase provides methods already to compare keys, so we can use those when we get to that point. Selva's ideas of using other metrics are worth exploring as well. I am not sure what to do about the memstore issue. The good news is that it throws things off by only 10-20%, whereas before things could be off by orders of magnitude. I think I'll go ahead and commit this change since it is an improvement on what's there. I will file a follow-on JIRA for multi-column families. Or if there is an existing JIRA for that, I'll make a note that this needs to be addressed there.
To Suresh's question about JIRA TRAFODION-823, this issue may well be related. Further research is needed to confirm.

To Suresh's comment about aligned row format, I had considered this too. I did a unit test to make sure that row estimates were correct for the aligned row format case. I asked myself the question of whether making a fast path for that case was reasonable, but decided that the overhead seemed small and I didn't want to introduce more complexity at this stage. But it is worth considering in the future.
To Suresh's question about JIRA TRAFODION-823, it turns out this is not the cause. The tables in that JIRA all have less than 255 columns.
Re: "just wonder..." Which line did you have in mind?
It looks like this function might be having a resource leak already. The stmt, srcDesc are not getting deallocated from SQL. If so, it would be good to fix it.

Hi Selva. I think the original author covered the resource leak problem. In line 207 of the new file, an HSRef object is created referencing the statement descriptor and the source text input descriptor. The HSRef destructor deallocates those objects. This is a nice technique actually because the HSRef object is created as a stack variable so its destructor will always be called (well, except for a longjmp).
I will commit this change as soon as tests pass.
Thanks Dave for your explanation. Yes. It is a clever technique.

Hans, A little question about the source code path, do you mean to merge it into trafodion-sql.jar?
Changes included:
1. rename package name to spjmgmt
2.create a role SPJ_EXECROLE for spj execution
Is this change ready to be committed?
We need to make sure we have regression tests added to the test library?   Kevin, did we add test case for this  fix to our test library?

Sorry for not seeing this earlier. Very good that you were able to make this fix. Just a question: For non-aligned format, I assume this won't cause us to write all the columns, even those with a NULL as default value?

I should have added this comment earlier. Yes. That's correct Hans. But upon further testing, the upsert command  for non-aligned format table has problems with omitted columns that has current_timestamp  as the default value when the row or the timestamp column doesn't exist already. So, I am working on a fix. The final fix that is being proposed is

Upsert for non-aligned format  will be transformed into merge when the column with current_timestamp as the default value is omitted. For rest of the cases, the current implementation works great.

Upsert for aligned format will be transformed to merge when a new CQD TRAF_UPSERT_DEFAULT_COLUMN_VALUE_OVERWRITE is 'OFF'.  When this CQD is set to 'ON', the upsert command will use the default value for the omitted columns whether the row exists or not. Need some opinion what should be the default for this CQD. Should it be 'ON' or 'OFF' by default.

So, I will be pushing another commit when I am ready with the fix.

Thanks, sounds very good! For TRAF_UPSERT_DEFAULT_COLUMN_VALUE_OVERWRITE, I would probably go with "OFF", the space-saving method. If people want to gain time at the expense of space, they can turn this on. But that's not a strong opinion.
Close the request since it was merged already as noted by Hans.
Withdrawn due to messed up branch.
Kevin, yes, this could be included in trafodion-sql.jar, if you move the source files.

The current name, org.trafodion.spjmgmt is also ok (although I have pointed out before that it is not SPJ management, but library management). The name of the role, SPJ_EXECROLE is confusing, though. This is about a few SPJs for library management, the role sounds as it it were used for all SPJs.

Thanks for investigating this problem Kevin. I believe one of the cases it is seen is when zookeeper default logging is changed (as per the output in the Jira).

I think we still need to do check if this can be handled in our bin  scripts or we should look at the corresponding zkcli code in dcs (use lastInfodexOf etc). Currently with the change and DEBUG/INFO on, repeat of a dcsstop will still give the sed error. Same should be the case for dcsstart (if no master is running) - script will try and do an ssh and sed on the zookeeper debug/info line. 

Do please check and let me know if the above observation is correct. It's possible I didn't catch the correct scenario from the Jira stated.

Yes, the SPJ_EXECROLE name seems to suggest it is for ALL spjs on the system.  Calling the role DB__LIBRARYMGRROLE or DB__LIBMGRROLE might be appropriate since it clearly states the scope of these system SPJs which are solely to mange the underlying code files used by the library objects. And the DB__ prefix is because this is a system created role.

Dave, please feel free to commit.
Anu, For QA test case, i'm not sure. For me, have already done the testing.

Nothing impact. Master has already been killed. as you see, no master node in zookeeper as follows:
[poc@esgvm-8 dcs]$ ./bin/dcs --config /data/esgyndb/traf-plus/dcs/bin/../conf org.trafodion.dcs.zookeeper.ZkUtil /poc/dcs/master

localhost: stopping server.

Thanks Kevin. Do please describe the scenario in the Jira (any change to dcs config, hbase config etc that leads to the failure of dcsstart/dcsstop that is being fixed) so that I can use that for the commit message.
As you see, the code is here. I'm not sure what you need. Anyway, already added some comments in JIRA.

Sorry for not being clear. dcsstart and dcsstop are currently working in other environments. I wanted to check what is different and then mention the same during merge (for example in other environments zookeeper debug messages are not seen).
